derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: variant of the noun slush

entry.def: If a liquid sloshes around or if you slosh it around, it moves around in different directions.

example.ex: The water sloshed around the bridge...
He took a mouthful of the cheap wine and sloshed it around his mouth...
example.tran: 他喝了一口廉价的葡萄酒，在嘴巴里来回咂摸着。

entry.tran: 踩着(水或泥浆等)走;扑哧扑哧地走
entry.def: If you slosh through mud or water, you walk through it in an energetic way, so that the mud or water makes sounds as you walk.

example.ex: The two girls joined arms and sloshed through the mud together.
example.tran: 两个女孩挽着胳膊，一道趟过了泥浆。

sentences.sentence: "We had to splosh across the wet meadow"

means.word_mean: 3. spill or splash copiously or clumsily;

sentences.en: Don’t slosh too much water on the floor when you’re having a bath.
sentences.cn: 洗澡时别把太多水溅到地板上。

sentences.en: The water was sloshing around in the bucket.
sentences.cn: 水在桶里哗啦哗啦地晃着。

sentences.en: The children were sloshing around in the puddles.
sentences.cn: 孩子们在啪嗒啪嗒地踩水坑。

sentences.en: There seems to be lots of money sloshing around in professional tennis.
sentences.cn: 职业网球比赛可谓金钱滚滚。
